final_topics.title: Solid Practitioners Meeting Logistics
final_topics.summary: These groups primarily focus on logistical arrangements for the Solid Practitioners meetings, including scheduling, time zone confirmations, and sharing meeting links, agendas, recordings and notes.  A recurring theme is ensuring accessibility to meeting materials and resolving any technical difficulties that arise, as well as rotating scribing duties and addressing gender balance in note-taking responsibilities.

final_topics.title: Solid Web Component Development
final_topics.summary: These conversations center around the development and coordination of Solid web components.  Discussions include planning meetups, addressing technical challenges like reactive rendering and interoperability, and announcing new tools and components, such as a CSS component scaffolder and an SSO authentication bridge.

final_topics.title: Solid Data Indexing and Search
final_topics.summary: These groups focus on strategies for indexing and searching data within Solid applications. They cover topics such as standardizing search APIs, designing federated geosearch architectures using Community Pods, and exploring different indexing mechanisms. They also include the management of meetings dedicated to search, as well as call for papers regarding the topic.

final_topics.title: Practitioners Group Governance and Strategy
final_topics.summary: The conversations here revolve around the governance and strategic direction of the Solid Practitioners Group. Discussions encompass the group's role within the broader Solid ecosystem and the Open Data Institute (ODI), including charter development, co-chair elections, and participation in the ODI Solid Advisory Committee.  Ethical considerations regarding monetization strategies are also debated.

final_topics.title: Solid Notifications and Webhooks
final_topics.summary: This topic cluster focuses on Solid notifications and webhooks. Discussions cover implementation experiences with different Pod providers, challenges with server standardization and notification limitations, as well as the creation of a dedicated chat channel for Real Time Solid (RTS) efforts. It also includes scheduling and feedback related to Practitioners meetings specifically addressing these topics.

final_topics.title: Solid Onboarding and Education
final_topics.summary: These conversations centered on improving Solid onboarding and education. One group explored using a GPT agent trained on Solid information, while another focused on creating explainer content and establishing a dedicated chat room for explaining Solid's practical applications, including coordinating with the W3C Community Group 'Solid Explainer' initiative.

final_topics.title: Solid Application Interoperability (SAI)
final_topics.summary: These discussions revolved around Solid Application Interoperability (SAI), covering topics like user profile data handling with PII, access control UX for Solid applications, and clarification of the SAI specification. There was also discussion contrasting the 'everything app' approach with specialized apps using interop and sharing architecture-as-code tools for Solid architecture.

final_topics.title: Solid Data Shapes and Ontologies
final_topics.summary: The focus of these discussions was on defining data shapes and ontologies within Solid. This included defining a common shape for products and services, collaborating on SHACL shapes and ontologies for specific applications like products and services, and discussing interoperability and data fetching using shapes, leading to the creation of a centralized Solid Shapes wiki and catalog.

final_topics.title: Solid Server Implementations
final_topics.summary: These conversations covered various aspects of Solid server implementations. This included proposals for a Server Practitioners subgroup, troubleshooting Node Solid Server (NSS) deployments, discussing infrastructure migration from NSS to PIVOT, and a comparison of Synovient and open-source Solid Pods.

final_topics.title: Solid OIDC Standardization
final_topics.summary: These discussions focused on standardizing aspects of Solid-OIDC (OpenID Connect). One conversation centered on standardizing Solid-OIDC provider metadata to improve user experience during login, while another discussed standardizing WebID document information for Pod providers to improve UI consistency.

final_topics.title: TrinPod Server Discussions
final_topics.summary: Discussions revolved around setting up and debugging a group pod on TrinPod, specifically addressing issues related to WebID parsing and adding members. The group also explored how TrinPod manages access and privacy for group pods through the use of private triples within user's personal pods for application discovery.

final_topics.title: Solid Localization and Internationalization
final_topics.summary: These conversations focused on strategies and tools for localizing Solid projects, evaluating options like Project Fluent, Vue i18n, and Weblate for community-driven translations. Participants also shared technical examples of internationalization using Wikidata for RDF data negotiation.

final_topics.title: ActivityPub and Solid Integration
final_topics.summary: The groups explored the integration of ActivityPub with Solid, including discussions on inbox validation and the potential for new abstractions. Participants shared meeting recaps, videos, and discussed the viability of different approaches, ultimately favoring the ActivityPods architecture.

final_topics.title: Community Introductions and Greetings
final_topics.summary: These groups consist of introductions and welcomes for new community members, with participants sharing their backgrounds, organizational affiliations (or lack thereof), and expressing enthusiasm for Solid.  Announcements, acknowledgements, and inquiries about Solid-related events and resources also appear frequently.

final_topics.title: Solid Project Funding and Grants
final_topics.summary: These conversations center around funding opportunities for Solid projects, with requests for transatlantic collaboration for NGI Sargasso grant applications. There was also an inquiry into ODI's distribution plan for a new Solid grant, seeking clarity on how funds would be allocated across different stakeholders.

final_topics.title: Sleepy.bike & Hospitality Networks
final_topics.summary: These discussions center on Sleepy Bike, a hospitality exchange project, including its relationship to WarmShowers and geographic scope. Participants also shared background information on the history of hospitality exchange communities, highlighting potential pitfalls and alternative networks like OpenHospitalityNetwork.

final_topics.title: Solid Job Search and Hiring
final_topics.summary: One focus is on job searching, with participants sharing resources and announcements of availability within the Solid community. Additionally, there were announcements regarding open positions at ODI for Solid-related roles, specifically mentioning a preference for candidates in London.

final_topics.title: Solid World Event Feedback
final_topics.summary: Discussions involved general feedback about the recent Solid World event, with participants sharing greetings and project updates. The recording and slides from the June Solid World event were also shared, including a higher-quality slide deck for NextGraph.

final_topics.title: Oracle Aconex Solid Integration
final_topics.summary: An announcement was made regarding the launch of the Oracle Aconex Accelerator, integrating Solid technology into Construction technology.

final_topics.title: SolidCouch Conflict Resolution
final_topics.summary: A conflict arose regarding the SolidCouch repository ownership and license changes, leading to the conflict being referred to the CoC Committee, followed by a memberâ€™s departure and confirmation that CoC reporting is now handled by ODI Ombuds.

final_topics.title: Solid Catalog Restructuring
final_topics.summary: These groups focus on restructuring the Solid Catalog, separating data from applications and moving it to its own repository. Discussions include the new frontend interface, search implementation, the inclusion of research papers, V2 testing and persistence strategy, the definition of metadata predicates, repository governance, form development, and general maintenance.

final_topics.title: Solid in Mexico Initiatives
final_topics.summary: Jeff Zucker facilitated an introduction between two members interested in discussing the application and policies of Solid technology within the context of the Mexican government.

final_topics.title: Data Scalability and Pagination
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed the current lack of standardized server-side pagination methods in Solid for handling large datasets like chat logs, noting existing workarounds and limitations regarding document vs. triple level operations.

final_topics.title: Solid Group Scope Clarification
final_topics.summary: A member declined an invitation to join the W3C Solid Community Group due to time constraints, leading to a clarification that the Practitioners group prioritizes active project work over general Solid happenings.

final_topics.title: Trusted Apps and Authorization Methods
final_topics.summary: The conversation debated the use of acl:trustedApp as a historical workaround for global app access, noting that current server implementations handle authorization differently and mentioning SAI as an alternative direction.

final_topics.title: Solid Data Modules Promotion
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed and agreed to share information about the Solid Data Modules project on wedistribute.org.

final_topics.title: Solid Compound Project (UX/DX)
final_topics.summary: A participant requested a link and information about the 'Solid Compound' project, which focuses on improving UX and DX, and the relevant GitHub link was provided.

final_topics.title: Career Data Management PoC
final_topics.summary: A newcomer sought advice for building a Proof of Concept (PoC) for career data management, leading to community recommendations favoring the Community Solid Server (CSS), Javascript/Typescript, and guidance on ontology and interoperability conventions.

final_topics.title: Solvent: Native Solid Applications
final_topics.summary: An announcement was made regarding Solvent, a project enabling Solid applications to run natively over a user's file system using Manas and Tauri.

final_topics.title: RDF JavaScript Tooling and Presentation
final_topics.summary: The discussions covered RDF tooling for JavaScript, including scheduled presentations and past practitioner meetings featuring demos of tools like SAI and LDO.js. Some focus was on the status of RDF library support in languages like Python and Perl, as well as data transparency and the use of linked data in the context of Large Language Models (LLMs).

final_topics.title: Solid Forum Discussions
final_topics.summary: These discussions center around the expansion and federation of Solid forums. They include the launch of a new federated forum using ActivityPub and NodeBB, along with increased engagement and cross-invitation from Spanish-speaking members within the Solid Podspace forum.

final_topics.title: Travel Advice and Solid
final_topics.summary: Rahul asked for bike hiring advice in Paris, receiving a referral to the sleepy.bike Matrix room, later confirming the trip was over.

final_topics.title: Solid Dev Resources Request
final_topics.summary: These discussions focus on improving Solid development resources and developer experience. Participants are requesting inspiring resources for new developers and offering feedback on the poor quality and outdated state of official Solid documentation, especially from Inrupt, while praising community resources.

final_topics.title: Hackathon Link (Context Missing)
final_topics.summary: A single link to a Gitter hackathon room was posted without context.

final_topics.title: Sleepy.bike Project Internal Issues
final_topics.summary: Mariha updated the community on the difficult internal situation of the sleepy.bike project, confirming a 'schism' resulting in two incomplete, one-person teams.

final_topics.title: Solid Interoperability Challenges Summary
final_topics.summary: A developer shared a resource summarizing challenges and practices concerning Solid interoperability and invited discussion on the Solid forum.

final_topics.title: Startup Introduction and Collaboration
final_topics.summary: A non-technical startup from Australia introduced themselves, expressing interest in integrating Solid Pods and seeking connections with local experts or Inrupt for collaboration.

final_topics.title: Researcher Intro: Solid Search & LLMs
final_topics.summary: Mohammad Bahrani from the University of Southampton introduced his research project focused on efficient, secure, and sovereign search over Solid pods using LLMs and Federated Learning.

final_topics.title: Solid Symposium Panel Proposals
final_topics.summary: These discussions revolve around proposals and announcements for the upcoming Solid Symposium. Topics include organizing an international panel focusing on diverse applications of Solid and promoting specific sessions such as 'Solid Together' (for societal good projects) and the ESPRESSO workshop (for decentralized search).

final_topics.title: CRDTs in Solid Meeting
final_topics.summary: Links were shared referencing a W3C public-solid email announcing the scheduling of a meeting focused on Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRTDs) in Solid.

final_topics.title: Solid Use Cases Collection
final_topics.summary: A request was made to community members to contribute their Solid projects and use cases to a list on the Solid forum to demonstrate Solid in action.

final_topics.title: Solid Events and SHACL Survey
final_topics.summary: This group contains two independent announcements: an invitation to participate in a Solid panel discussion at the State of Open Con conference, and a link to a survey regarding SHACL shapes.

final_topics.title: MCP and LLM Integration Feasibility
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed the feasibility of creating a Solid adapter for Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP), debating how MCP and RAG approaches differ concerning data querying, local data manipulation, and the privacy risks associated with LLM training on user data.

final_topics.title: Fediverse Tools and Troubleshooting
final_topics.summary: The conversation covered troubleshooting issues with Mastopod, coordinating a switch of Peertube hosting instances, and offering general recommendations for various Fediverse services and clients like Mastodon, Lemmy, and Pixelfed.

final_topics.title: Solid Hackathon Planning
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed organizing non-competitive Solid hackathons focused on specific projects like PASS and sleepy.bike, establishing preliminary goals and structure requirements, and reflecting on the competitive nature of such events.

final_topics.title: Access Control Group WebIDs
final_topics.summary: The discussion explored the utility of Group WebIDs versus URIs for access control, particularly addressing the challenge of authorizing access to resources based on private group membership lists (e.g., foaf:Group or vcard:Group) without making the member list public.

final_topics.title: RFC9421 Message Signing Follow-up
final_topics.summary: Following a discussion on cryptographic keys, an accepted standard (RFC 9421) for message signing was introduced, prompting planning for a future dedicated meeting in March to discuss its application within Solid.

final_topics.title: Solid Ecosystem and Applications Discovery
final_topics.summary: These conversations focus on improving the discoverability and cataloging of Solid applications and resources within the ecosystem. Participants are discussing the creation of an RDF description for the Solid ecosystem, requesting additions to the Solid catalog, and clarifying the current status of Solid app listings.

final_topics.title: Solid Governance and Community Initiatives
final_topics.summary: These discussions are centered on Solid governance and community initiatives. One topic is promoting meetings regarding proposed changes in Solid project governance, while the other involves discussing a CG proposal exploring how Solid can support censorship resistance and protect user privacy.

final_topics.title: Solid Authentication and Authorization Mechanisms
final_topics.summary: These discussions centered on authentication and authorization within the Solid ecosystem. Topics included identifying UMA flow implementations in Solid Pods, harmonizing authentication specifications through short-term meetings, and addressing the challenges of authenticating non-web applications.

final_topics.title: Solid Event Announcements and Participation
final_topics.summary: An announcement is shared regarding FediCon, an event focused on the Open Social Web, inviting projects for various social protocols.

final_topics.title: Solid Data and Technology Challenges
final_topics.summary: This topic cluster addressed challenges related to Solid data and technology. Discussions ranged from concerns regarding consent and data control in external health data aggregation initiatives to questions about network security and loop prevention in decentralized social queries.

final_topics.title: Solid and Linked Data Relationship
final_topics.summary: Members share resources on binary RDF formats like Jelly RDF, HDT, and CBOR-LD, discussing historical usage, performance issues, and potential solutions like streaming protocols.

final_topics.title: ActivityPods Compatibility and Integration
final_topics.summary: These groups focused on the integration and compatibility of ActivityPods within the Solid ecosystem. Discussions included technical aspects such as group pods, ActivityPub implementation over Solid, ODRL, RDF document structure and sharing reports detailing adaptation challenges.

final_topics.title: Web Access Control Discussion Room
final_topics.summary: A user inquired about a dedicated room for discussing Web Access Control (WAC) and was directed to the general Solid specification channel.

final_topics.title: PeerTube and Video Hosting Discussions
final_topics.summary: The conversations here revolved around PeerTube and video hosting related to Solid. This included discussions about a new Solid Practitioners PeerTube channel, content uploading, hosting strategies, licensing, and logistics for sharing transportation meeting recordings.

final_topics.title: DICOM Metadata to RDF Conversion
final_topics.summary: A user announced the release of a program to extract DICOM metadata as RDF for querying pathology and radiology data stored in Solid PODs.

final_topics.title: Contacts Spec Migration Plans
final_topics.summary: The Contacts client-client spec group sought feedback from practitioners regarding the feasibility of migrating from `vcard:AddressBook` to `foaf:AddressBook`, acknowledging the need for backward compatibility support over several years.

final_topics.title: AI Code Generation Feedback
final_topics.summary: Members shared mixed feedback on the utility and security of GenAI code editors/copilots, discussing both positive formatting capabilities and negative experiences involving bugs and potential security vulnerabilities.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous Solid Announcements
final_topics.summary: This topic covered miscellaneous announcements and discussions relevant to Solid. These included product updates, news about bridges, mailing list confirmations, workshop announcements, and clarification regarding the relationship between Solid and Linked Web Storage (LWS).

final_topics.title: Inrupt Migration Issues Reporting
final_topics.summary: Users reported difficulties accessing resources due to broken links resulting from the Inrupt migration, including a Solid Symposium page and the Real Time Solid website, with the page owner acknowledging the issue.

final_topics.title: Datasolids and HIPAA Compliance Debates
final_topics.summary: These conversations centered on the use of Datasolids in the context of HIPAA compliance. Participants debated whether Datasolids' architecture, particularly its approach to data silos and abstraction layers, aligns with both HIPAA security requirements and the broader principles of Solid interoperability, with discussions emphasizing that compliance is heavily process-dependent.

final_topics.title: MANDAT Project Requirements and Architecture
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed the MANDAT project, focusing on its advanced Solid capabilities like organizational delegation and data provision chains, and sought clarification on the underlying legal and high-level requirements for bank/SMB use cases versus technical implementation details.

final_topics.title: PodQuest Technical Details Questions
final_topics.summary: The group shared the video recording of recent presentations and posed follow-up questions regarding technical details of PodQuest, specifically WebID scoped indexes and open-sourcing the application.

final_topics.title: Solid External Links and Resources
final_topics.summary: Participants shared various external links and resources related to Solid and related technologies. This included links to web servers (MyceliumWebServer), blog posts explaining Data Wallets, ODRL examples for agent delegation, workshops on geo data and AI control, news articles on data leaks, and articles on graph security.

final_topics.title: Decentralized Systems Academic Paper
final_topics.summary: A link to an arXiv paper on decentralized systems is shared for community reading.

final_topics.title: Catalog Viewer Coordination
final_topics.summary: Elf Pavlik announces a new Catalog Viewer tool and coordinates presentation timing for upcoming Solid meetings, deciding Rui will present sooner due to constraints.

final_topics.title: Valueflows Introduction and Project
final_topics.summary: Elf Pavlik introduces Lynn Foster (Valueflows), sparking a discussion about the project's resonance with Solid use cases like ERP and food networks, and welcoming new members.

final_topics.title: Food Scarcity Planning Session
final_topics.summary: These discussions revolved around planning a practitioners' session focused on food scarcity and short supply chains. The initial plan for a September 18th session, which included a presentation on Valueflows, was ultimately postponed due to speaker cancellations, leading to a shift towards a community reflection and update meeting.

final_topics.title: Solid Calendar Link Troubleshooting
final_topics.summary: The participants discussed finding the Solid Practitioners meeting schedule and troubleshooting why link previews (thumbnails/images) were missing on some Solid links but present on the W3C link, suggesting meta tags or caching issues as potential causes.

final_topics.title: DIY Solid Setup and Bug
final_topics.summary: Ewingson shared documentation for his DIY Solid setup involving multiple IDPs and noted a bug in the Hydrogen Matrix client where editing messages causes duplication.

final_topics.title: Podcast Interview Scheduling Update
final_topics.summary: Jeff followed up on scheduling a podcast interview with Damon, who apologized for the delay due to a family emergency and confirmed he would reach out via email.

final_topics.title: Meeting Technical Glitch Report
final_topics.summary: A participant noted a brief technical glitch where another user appeared frozen during the meeting.

final_topics.title: Solid Adoption and Maturity Debate
final_topics.summary: These conversations focused on the readiness and maturity of Solid for production use. The debate covered Solid's data sovereignty benefits against centralized solutions, with perspectives ranging from viewing Solid as being in an 'alpha test period' to recognizing it as a practical platform suitable for application development today.

final_topics.title: Resource Catalog Data Entry Issues
final_topics.summary: Users debugged an issue where the resources catalog form complained about unencoded spaces in IRIs for the maintainer field, with the developer advising temporary workarounds until a permanent solution is deployed.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous Orphaned Messages
final_topics.summary: These groups contain miscellaneous, often orphaned, messages that were not easily categorized. This includes unrelated administrative, social, and academic exchanges (like greetings, identity management discussions, and emoji interpretations), as well as standalone links to search engines or application screencasts shared without further context.

final_topics.title: Unix Timestamp Celebration
final_topics.summary: A brief, off-topic announcement celebrated the Unix Timestamp reaching 1.7 billion.
